executive_summary: Escalating external competition and tepid growth in alcohol expenditure have constrained revenue growth for the Karaoke Bars industry over the five years to 2021. Consumer spending has assuaged these factors somewhat, as renewed interest in high-end karaoke bars has stimulated consumer interest in urban areas. While the primary driver behind the industry's structural decline has been the continued shift of karaoke fans away from karaoke bars and into the comfort of their own homes, growth in the domestic economy and increased consumer spending prevented substantial decline over the five years to 2021. However, added pressures during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic ultimately drove down industry revenue, resulting in revenue declining an estimated annualized 0.7% over the five years to 2021 to $1.1 billion, including a 17.1% surge in 2021 alone amid economic recovery.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Over the five years to 2021, the performance of the Karaoke Bars industry has been revived slightly by improving economic conditions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Karaoke Bar industry provides patrons with karaoke entertainment along with food and drinks, which are considered discretionary services and are subject to changing economic conditions and consumer preferences. During the period, the industry has contended with mounting external competition and muted alcohol expenditure growth. The industry's long-term decline has been mitigated somewhat by two factors. First, consumer spending has increased an annualized 2.4% over the past five years as the domestic economy has grown and per capita disposable income has increased.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Console-based karaoke-style video games have grown in popularity because they can digitally track a player's performance and provide feedback
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: almost anywhere. These developments have lured consumers away from karaoke bars, which is challenging for industry operators, as the majority of their revenue is sourced from alcoholic beverages consumed within their establishments. In response, industry operators are investing in new technology to win back old customers and attract new ones. Karaoke systems now offer touch-screen playlists that are easy to use and backed by an impressive library of new and old songs, listed digitally with an on-screen search function. However, external competition is expected to continue to challenge industry operators, pressuring industry profit.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Over the five years to 2026, industry revenue is anticipated to increase slightly
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the five years to 2026, industry revenue is anticipated to increase slightly, bolstered by economic recovery at the start of the period. Thus, revenue is anticipated to increase at an annualized rate of 0.4% over the next five years to total $1.1 million. As a means to counteract the industry's structural decline, karaoke bars are anticipated to more closely focus on their target markets in the years ahead, primarily individuals aged 35 and younger. Further, they are anticipated to offer higher quality products and services, such as improved technology to attract more consumers. Despite technological investments to draw in these consumers, the number of industry establishments is anticipated to continue declining over the five years to 2026.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Despite an improving macroeconomic landscape in the aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic and the growth of private room karaoke offerings, the industry will battle obstacles
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite an improving macroeconomic landscape in the aftermath of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and the growth of private room karaoke offerings, the Karaoke Bars industry will battle various obstacles moving forward. This will come specifically from the continued competition from external options, such as in-home and internet-based karaoke systems, other bar formats and other group-oriented nightlife activities. Despite competitive pressures, a sharp return to bars, including karaoke bars, as restrictions ease, revenue for the Karaoke Bars industry is forecast to rise at an annualized rate of 0.4% over the five years to 2026 to reach $1.1 billion.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: As the macroeconomic conditions improve, the industry will likely be temporarily bolstered by growth in disposable income
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the macroeconomic conditions improve at the start of the five-year outlook period in the aftermath of the pandemic, the industry will likely be temporarily bolstered by growth in disposable income, enabling higher spending on industry services. However, the industry is expected to return to its long-term decline as the industry contends with mounting competitive pressures. As consumer confidence falls, patrons will be more likely to conserve their spending and choose to eat and drink at home more often, reducing the amount consumers spend at karaoke bars. Although consumer spending is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 2.5% over the five years to 2026, these trends are not anticipated to be sufficient enough to offset the long-term decline in demand for karaoke bars due to competition from video games and internet-based karaoke systems.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Karaoke bars are anticipated to more closely focus on their target markets in the years ahead
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As a means to counteract the industry's structural decline, karaoke bars are anticipated to more closely focus on their target markets in the years ahead. In 2021, individual consumers are anticipated to account for 91.9% of total industry revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry business owners are investing in new technology to win back old customers and attract new ones
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In response to the shift away from the karaoke bar, industry business owners are investing in new technology to win back old customers and attract new ones. The karaoke bar industry has invested in (and will continue to invest in) wireless-based technology. This includes wireless microphones and wireless song request systems. Karaoke systems now also offer touch-screen playlists that are easy to use and backed by an impressive library of new and old songs, listed digitally with an on-screen search function.

industry_definition: This industry includes bars that offer karaoke entertainment along with food and drinks. Karaoke is a form of interactive entertainment or video game in which amateur singers can sing along with recorded music (or a music video) using a microphone and public address system.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady barriers to entry level

key_trends: The industry has been revived slightly by improving economic conditions
Competition from video games and cell phone technology has encroached on industry revenue
Industry revenue has been hurt by alcohol consumption moving away from bulk drinking
The industry was temporarily bolstered by growth in disposable income
Businesses have remained steady as a share of revenue in recent years, due to an overall rise in corporate profit
Industry businesses are investing in new technology to win back old customers and attract new ones
Karaoke bars will offer higher quality products and services, such as improved technology to attract more consumers

FAQs.question: Does your company partner with local merchants to market your products and services?
FAQs.answer: Operators that partner with other local bars, restaurants and services may have added benefit of dual marketing. Many operators only partner with other locations when they do not offer a specific service, such as food service.

FAQs.question: How do review sites, such as Yelp and Google Reviews, impact sales?
FAQs.answer: Companies that can maintain a high Yelp or Google review have the added benefit of enticing more consumers to attend their bar. Consumers increasingly rely on these reviews to decide between establishments.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in high-traffic areas to increase visibility?
FAQs.answer: Karaoke bars that are situated in areas that have high visibility are more likely to have a steady stream of patrons, solely due to the convenience of their location.

FAQs.question: Do you offer ancillary services to diversify revenue streams?
FAQs.answer: Some Karaoke bars offer food service, happy hour deals or other ancillary services such as doubling as a coffee shop during the day, as a way to diversify their revenue.

FAQs.question: Does your company offer web-based booking to improve consumer accessibility?
FAQs.answer: Karaoke bars that offer table or room reservations online may benefit from consumers booking in advance as people seek the convenience of online reservations in favor of calling.

FAQs.question: Does your company leverage mobile booking applications to streamline the booking process?
FAQs.answer: Some karaoke bars have enabled mobile based song requests that allow customers to add their song to the queue without needing to leave their table. This encourages more people to participate in singing.

FAQs.question: What measures does your company take to ensure all employees are compliant with food handling and safety?
FAQs.answer: Karaoke bars that ensure employees receive substantial training have an easier time ensuring they abide by strict health and safety standards.

FAQs.question: What additional measures have you taken amid the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Many operators have needed to shut down or shift operations to comply with the regulatory environment during the pandemic.

FAQs.question: Is your company subject to any franchising laws?
FAQs.answer: Most karaoke bars are locally owned and have a single location. Unlike some large chain bars, karaoke bars are often not franchised.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'? How did the pandemic affect profitability?
FAQs.answer: Operators that offer premium services often have a higher profit margin than those who are not able to charge high premiums.

FAQs.question: How does your company's inventory turnover rate compare to your major competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Inventory turnover is high, similar to the broader accommodation sector. Operators that manage an efficient inventory are more likely to optimize their profit margins.

FAQs.question: What do you do to promote loyalty and to keep your customers returning for follow-up visits? Having a loyal customer base
FAQs.answer: Establishing a base of repeat customers is crucial to smooth revenue fluctuations and generate sufficient positive recommendations, particularly in order to ensure customer loyalty.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Operators should consistently invest in technological improvements as a means to remain competitive against alternative forms of entertainment. With the rise of alternative sources of karaoke, operators need to keep up-to-date with the latest technological advances.

FAQs.question: Which niches, if any, do you cater to? How can you diversify your product mix?
FAQs.answer: It is crucial for karaoke bars to maintain a diverse range of song options for clients to expand their customer bases.

FAQs.question: Do you find revenue trends to be in line with changes in competition?
FAQs.answer: Domestic karaoke bars experience a high and increasing level of external competition, particularly as consumers increasingly shifted to at-home karaoke in response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your sales are to adults 20 to 64? What other markets are significant to your business?
FAQs.answer: Given that alcoholic beverage sales account for the majority of the industry's revenue, karaoke bars generate most of their revenue from adults over the age of 21, particularly individuals aged 21 to 35, who tend to spend the most on food and drink services outside of the home.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor trends in consumer spending and how they affect demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: Consumer spending, or aggregate consumption, measures the total amount spent by Americans on services and new goods and net purchases of used goods, both domestically and abroad. Although consumer spending outperformed expectations during the pandemic, strict regulations affecting industry operations limited spending at karaoke bars.
